definition: Japanophile (refers to teenage craze for everything Japanese, originally mainly in Taiwan)
abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin
a Pekinese/a pug/(dialect) to scold
(interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
race/nationality/ethnicity/clan/by extension, social group (e.g. office workers 上班族)
otaku, a Japanese term for people with obsessive interests such as anime, manga, and video games/see also 宅男[zhai2 nan2]/see also 宅女[zhai2 nu:3]
(slang) Japan (loanword from the Japanese word for Japan, "Nihon")
Korean (derog.)
to abandon the old (Asian) ways and learn from Europe/refers to the ideas that led to the Meiji Restoration and Japan's subsequent colonization projects in Asia
groupie (slang)/idolator
to idolize foreign things
older man/man of mature years (Japanese loanword)
shit youth/used satirically against 憤青|愤青 which shares the same sound/see also 憤青|愤青[fen4 qing1]
to revere everything foreign and pander to overseas powers (idiom); blind worship of foreign goods and ideas
angry youth/positive term used to describe young Chinese with extreme nationalistic tendencies/see also 糞青|粪青[fen4 qing1]
(coll.) Japanese girl
lolicon or rorikon (Japanese loanword)/manga or anime genre depicting young girls in an erotic manner
(in Taiwan, Hong Kong or Macao) girl from the mainland/(Tw) Fushan lettuce 福山萵苣|福山莴苣[Fu2 shan1 wo1 ju4]
shotacon (Japanese loanword)/manga or anime genre depicting young boys in an erotic manner
to fawn on foreigners/to pander to foreign powers
bushidō or way of the warrior, samurai code of chivalry
